data.title: Save open tab sets
data.body:
Feature Request

I often need to switch between tasks and will open a set of files for each task that I am working on. For instance, I may be working on a long-term feature ticket on the server side of my app and have open our `server.js` and a few other files related to the issue. I then get a hotfix that I need to take care of on the client side and need to close those tabs, open another set of client-side code files to work on that hotfix, then go back and try to remember which files I had open for the long-term feature.

It would be useful to be able to save the tab set that I have open, switch to the new task and finish it up, then simply use that saved set to reopen those tabs and restore that workspace.

Initial thoughts on feature requirements
- Ability to save a tab set with a user-specified identifier (this would save the tabs and the tab ordering)
- Ability to remove saved tab sets
- Ability to rename saved tab sets (this may add unnecessary complexity for a v1 feature)
- Menu for accessing the saved tabs, I'm thinking similar to switching files with `⌘/Ctrl+P` (maybe even use that same shortcut, since it's a sort of file-switching functionality)
- When accessing a tab set, either completely ignore files that no longer exist, or give a user-facing warning that certain files were not found, but still open all remaining files.

data.title: If an html attribute value starts with 'view' the closing double quote is not recognized
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: ErikLieben.aurelia-0.1.4, felixfbecker.php-debug-1.9.4, ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1, redhat.java-0.0.4, Telerik.nativescript-0.3.1, vsmobile.cordova-tools-1.2.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create an HTML file
2. Put the following text in:
   <html>
   <head>
       <meta name="viewport">
   </head>
   </html>
   ![vscodebug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13222616/19488002/dc521e12-9519-11e6-8805-6c9bc6b247ff.png)

In the above html everything after the second double quote in <meta name="viewport"> will be colored as an attribute value.  This only happens if the attribute value starts with the text 'view' but not if it is only the text 'view'.

data.title: API Feature Request: Fetch configuration default value
data.body:
You know how you have your Default Settings file and then your own User Settings file? Whenever you use the API to get configuration values, it pulls it from the User Settings file if it exists there, otherwise it falls back to the Default Settings file.

It would be nice to have the option to specifically pull configuration values from the Default Settings file. The reason is this:

Lets say you have a configuration value that is meant to be a boolean. Some sort of true/false value for your extension. And then someone copies this configuration value over to their User Settings file but they accidentally change it to a string instead of a boolean.

Now in your extension code, you need to obviously do a type check on the fetch configuration value to make sure it's a boolean. If it's not a boolean, you should probably fall back to the default value. But there is no way to fetch the default configuration value from the Default Settings. The only solution for this is to also hardcode your default value within your code and grab it from there.

I can't see a way to grab default values from configuration, so it would be really nice to have this option. Thanks,

data.title: Browser: serving whole of vscode on a webserver
data.body:
Are there any plans to allow serving the whole of the app using a webserver.

There are several projects that get around this, so I makes me think, it's better if this becomes part of vscode itself. Examples:
- https://github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph-go
- https://github.com/spiffcode/ghedit

If you have a rough idea on how to go about implementing it, I'll also take a look.

If you're wondering why I'm wanting to do this; the [monaco-editor](https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor) module doesn't contain as much features as `vscode` and, I think, it also falls behind a bit?

data.title: Show keybinding IntelliSense

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I am working on keymap extensions. One of the thing that I am missing is IntelliSense for the key attribute and its derivatives (in the context of creating an extension those derivatives are `"mac"`, `"linux"`, and `"win"`. 

In the image below I would like to see all the possible completions for `"win"`. This is important when I try to find how to indicate the context menu key on Windows. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/19486611/f2837f74-9513-11e6-85c5-fecea742fcb1.png)

Additionally, this sort of IntelliSense is not found in the `keybindings.json` file. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/19486642/12057794-9514-11e6-94f8-09603f059ef1.png)

Note - I am seeing only symbol completion scoped by the file I am in in both of the images below.

data.title: Support format on paste

data.title: Add an option to not focus sidebar from Cmd-B
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a code editor window
2. Mis-type Cmd-V (paste) and press Cmd-B (hide directory/file pane)
3. Press Cmd-B again to show the left pane again
4. Cuss and grab the mouse to click inside the editor because it has lost focus

Expected: Focus is still on editor window.

data.title: Provide 'files.endWithNewline'
data.body:
This issue appears on VS Code `v1.6.1` and Windows 10 Professional `v1607`.

VS Code is running with `--disable-extensions`, in user settings `html.format.endWithNewline` and `html.format.preserveNewLines` are both set to `true`, yet not only is VS Code failing to generate ending newlines when I invoke "Format Code", the existing ending newlines are being actively purged.

Workspace settings are basically empty, nor are there any other formatting configurations present such as `.editorconfig` etc, user settings file is as follows:

```
{
    "files.eol": "\n",
    "files.autoSave": "onFocusChange",
    "editor.tabSize": 4,
    "editor.formatOnSave": false,
    "editor.trimAutoWhitespace": false,
    "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": false,
    "html.format.endWithNewline": true,
    "html.format.preserveNewLines": true
}
```

Yet, the ending newlines are being trimmed on format everywhere except for `.html` files.

data.title: Task arguments not clearly documented
data.body:
Usage of arguments in tasks.json is not clearly documented. In the following example the same arguments are used in a terminal and in tasks.json. The latter is not working.
- VSCode Version: latest
- OS Version: mac os x

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  first try the following node-sass command directly in the terminal and see that it runs
   `node-sass --output-style compressed resources/assets/sass/materialize.scss public/css/hr-materialize.css`
2. then create a vs code task with the same arguments and see it crash and burn

```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "node-sass",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["--output-style compressed", "resources/assets/sass/materialize.scss", "public/css/hr-materialize.css"]
}
```

data.title: Test: debug settings
data.body:

- `"debug.allowBreakpointsEverywhere"`
- `"debug.openExplorerOnEnd"`

data.title: Format Code should be Format Document and Format Selection
data.body: Today the Format Code action is either or. When there is a selection _and_ a selection formatter we use that, when there is no selection we format the document. We should be more explicit about this.

data.title: Please rename the "restart" parts in UI texts to "reload"
data.body:
As per #3592 and @bpasero, there currently is no restart command in VS Code that would do the full thing. 

What more, @bpasero argues that "Restart Now" does a window reload as a bug because if you have a second window open, you need to do the same action there too to benefit from the extension. I am not sure if it really is a bug, but nevertheless it would be a lot less confusing if the naming in that case would be more consistent.

Hence the request -- please rename the "Restart" parts in UI texts to "Reload". If no full restart is being done, then it makes no sense to name it as such.

Also, this proposed change would bring about another increase in consistency as there already is a "Reload Window" command which, at least on the surface, appears to do the very thing that is currently being disguised and labeled as a "Restart" in other parts of the UI.

data.title: Editor becomes unresponsive after hover preview of very large variable
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: MacOS 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. assign a variable a large amount of binary data
2. hover over the variable to get the preview

VS Code gets unresponsive. Eventually it returns back to normal, but it takes a long time.

Would expect VS Code not to show a preview of variables containing a large amount of data.

data.title: Cmd + Enter sometimes stages all and commit
data.body:
I've noticed that VSCode sometimes stages all and commit them after pressing CMD + Enter in the git commit message input. It never happens the first time. Though sometimes the 2nd time. But give it enough time it will stage all.
1. Stage some files through the GIT tab.
2. Give a commit message.
3. Press CMD + Enter.
4. Voila VSCode stages all files and commit them.

I've gotten very frustrated sometime when it stages all. When in fact I only want the already staged files to be committed.

data.title: Assess the state of formatting support in VS Code and its extensions
data.body:
We have a few extension that have implemented workaround for us not supporting formatOnSave or the onWillSave-event until lately (1.6). I have created the following issues to track adoption
- [x] https://github.com/taichi/react-beautify/issues/12 
- [x] https://github.com/HookyQR/VSCodeBeautify/issues/59

data.title: CSS language server doesn't apply filtering
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27)
- OS Version: Linux Fedora 24

I'm trying to consume the CSS language server from VSCode via stdio
`/usr/bin/node /usr/share/code/resources/app/extensions/css/server/out/cssServerMain.js --stdio`
and connect to it using the https://github.com/eclipselabs/eclipse-language-service and underlying https://github.com/TypeFox/ls-api
- Connection works, request are well sent and result well received.
- When trying to complete after the `a` in

``` css
a {
}
```

I see that `:checked` is proposed, whereas it doesn't make sense here. If I try VSCode directly, the `:checked` isn't proposed. It seems like VSCode has some additional filtering for the CSS pseudo-classes, and that this filtering is not part of the language server.

Could this filtering be part on the language server side?
